str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
A promise. From epaggello; an announcement.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To cleanse, make clean, literally, ceremonially, or spiritually, according to context. From katharos; to cleanse.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural

str2: From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Staining, defilement, pollution. From moluno; a stain; i.e. immorality.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To complete, accomplish, perfect. From epi and teleo; to fulfill further, i.e. Execute; by implication, to terminate, undergo.
A holy or sanctified state. From hagios; sacredness.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
(a) fear, terror, alarm, (b) the object or cause of fear, (c) reverence, respect. From a primary phebomai; alarm or fright.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
